name: Single View Creator Low Code - MongoDB
description: Create your Single Views leveraging the power of configuration files instead of writing all the code on your own!

single-view-creator-low-code-mongodb.name: single-view-creator-low-code-mongodb
single-view-creator-low-code-mongodb.description: Create your Single Views leveraging the power of configuration files instead of writing all the code on your own!

defaultEnvironmentVariables.name: TYPE
defaultEnvironmentVariables.description: Identifies the type of projection changes that need to be read. It should be the same as the Single View name you want to update.

defaultEnvironmentVariables.name: PROJECTIONS_MONGODB_URL
defaultEnvironmentVariables.description: MongoDB connection string where projections are stored. Must be a valid uri

defaultEnvironmentVariables.name: PROJECTIONS_DATABASE
defaultEnvironmentVariables.description: The db from where projections are read.

defaultEnvironmentVariables.name: SINGLE_VIEWS_MONGODB_URL
defaultEnvironmentVariables.description: MongoDB connection string where single view must be stored. Must be a valid uri

defaultEnvironmentVariables.name: SINGLE_VIEWS_DATABASE
defaultEnvironmentVariables.description: The db from where single views are written.

defaultEnvironmentVariables.name: SINGLE_VIEWS_COLLECTION
defaultEnvironmentVariables.description: It must be equal to the Single View name the service is in charge of.

defaultEnvironmentVariables.name: SINGLE_VIEWS_PORTFOLIO_ORIGIN
defaultEnvironmentVariables.description: An identifier for the Kafka client to be able to debug and track the requests. If this Single View Creator is responsible for handling only one system, we suggest to use the `SYSTEM_ID` specified in the Real Time Updater service.

defaultEnvironmentVariables.name: SINGLE_VIEWS_ERRORS_COLLECTION
defaultEnvironmentVariables.description: Name of a MongoDB CRUD you want to use as collection for single view errors.

defaultEnvironmentVariables.name: USE_AUTOMATIC
defaultEnvironmentVariables.description: wheather to use the low code architecture for the Single View Creator service or not

defaultEnvironmentVariables.name: ER_SCHEMA_FOLDER
defaultEnvironmentVariables.description: the path to the ER Schema folder, e.g. `/home/node/app/erSchema`

defaultEnvironmentVariables.name: AGGREGATION_FOLDER
defaultEnvironmentVariables.description: the path to the Aggregation folder, e.g. `/home/node/app/aggregation`

defaultEnvironmentVariables.name: CONFIGURATION_FOLDER
defaultEnvironmentVariables.description: Folder where configuration files are mounted

defaultEnvironmentVariables.name: PROJECTIONS_CHANGES_SOURCE
defaultEnvironmentVariables.description: Tells the plugin the source where projection changes are read.

defaultEnvironmentVariables.name: PROJECTIONS_CHANGES_DATABASE
defaultEnvironmentVariables.description: The db from where projections changes are read.

defaultEnvironmentVariables.name: PROJECTIONS_CHANGES_COLLECTION
defaultEnvironmentVariables.description: if you have set a custom projection change collection name from advanced, then set its name. Otherwise, it is `fd-pc-SYSTEM_ID` where `SYSTEM_ID` is the id of the System of Records this single view creator is responsible for.

defaultEnvironmentVariables.name: SCHEDULING_TIME
defaultEnvironmentVariables.description: a quantity of time in milliseconds, every X milliseconds the service wake up and check if there are some projections changes in NEW state to work on.
